arm_group.description: Contingent RT-fMRI-NF of brain activity in the target region of interest
Sham RT-fMRI-NF of brain activity of previously recorded subject

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the potential efficacy of real-time functional
      magnetic resonance imaging neurofeedback (RT-fMRI-NF) in regulating brain activity and
      psychophysiological functions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-Time Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging Neurofeedback for Regulation of Psychophysiological Functions

detailed_description.textblock:
The overall goal of the outlined study is to establish a real-time functional magnetic
      resonance imaging neurofeedback (RT-fMRI-NF) protocol aiming at modulating brain activity
      and psychophysiological functions. About two weeks after the initial training session it
      will be estimated how stable training effects have been. The two weeks in between, subjects
      will receive ambulatory training of the strategies via a smartphone-based application.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Sufficient spoken and written knowledge of English

          -  Right-handedness

          -  Access to smartphone

          -  Availability to participate in the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Color blindness

          -  Presence of cardiovascular disease

          -  Medication intake affecting cardiovascular function

          -  Medical MRI contraindication

intervention.intervention_name: real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging neurofeedback (RT-fMRI-NF)
intervention.other_name: There are no specific branded names etc. associated with the intervention.

intervention.description: Subjects are provided with an ambulatory training.

clinical_study.official_title: Real-Time Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging Neurofeedback for Regulation of Psychophysiological Functions

other_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

other_outcome.description: assessed via Multidimensional Mood State Questionnaire; Self-Assessment Manikin; Perceived Stress Scale
other_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

other_outcome.description: connectivity of brain activity determined by fmri signal
other_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

primary_outcome.description: assessed via oscillometry, expressed in mmHg
primary_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

primary_outcome.description: blood oxygenation level dependent (BOLD) signal assessed via functional magnetic resonance imaging, expressed in relative BOLD signal intensity
primary_outcome.measure: Blood oxygenation level dependent signal of the target brain region of interest
primary_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: number of subjects reporting an adverse event
secondary_outcome.measure: Feedback on adverse events during the scanner and ambulatory training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: study day 1; study day 2 (2 weeks later); anticipated: follow-up (up to 1 year)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
